ratings.comment: Professor Braxton is the goat. Exams are very reasonable and most questions are taken from previous exams.
Wouldn't round a grade up by 0.225% bffr that's the least you could do.

Was kind of boring in lecture, but attendance wasn't required so I never went and just did the posted slides and I was fine.  Material wasn't super in depth so it was super easy, but the final was a little rough.  Also only has like 2 office hours a week so you have to go to a TA instead.

Professor Braxton does an excellent job at explaining concepts and working through examples in lecture. Exams are fair and reflective of the material taught in class. I would highly recommend taking Macro with Professor Braxton.

Prof. Carter is a great teacher and person. His career and story are super cool, and his lectures are very interesting as a result. He genuinely cares about the students he teaches and always takes questions/responds to emails. Your grade is 75% tests and 25% HW, but the tests are light, and one is dropped. Recommend, you'll learn a lot from him.

An amazing professor. Lectures were straightforward and practice exams were super similar to actual exam. You can tell he cares about students and wants to teach relevant information without bias. Take econ 102 with Carter!
Great teacher

Of all Econ102 professors, you must take Carter Braxton. Great lectures, you won't be surprised by the material on exams, they're just like the practice exams. Make sure to study, exams are a big part of your grade. You still have to put in work for this class, but it is overall straightforward, which I appreciate.

Good, knowledgable, and well-rounded professor - explains very clearly and discussion is not mandatory! Short, easy, completion graded homework assignments each week. Though, exams are a large percent of your grade.
He is one of the best professors I have had. He cares about students, explains ideas clearly, and doesn't include anything thats irrelevant or unimportant.

Professor Braxton was so interesting! The textbook was only needed for homework. He gives past exam scripts to study and your exams will be exactly like those. He also grades your final grade based on how well you did (for example: you can get a midterm dropped). Discussions were not required but were super helpful.

Carter made Econ 102 much easier and straightforward compared to my Econ 101 professor. He would include textbook information on his lecture slides and made everything he taught accessible if you missed class. I recommend to anyone taking 102 to choose Carter as a professor.

I am a business student who struggles with economics, but he made macro easier to understand. Most fair exams in college so far. If you actually study, go to lecture, and review the slides, you will be fine. Really respect him for his exams and care for his students. Take him!

I loved having Braxton as my Econ 102 professor. He made the concepts easy to understand and showed real life examples. Exams were straightforward and fair. Lectures covered everything you need to know! Take him

As an intl studies major just getting a requirement, Braxton was a solid choice. He connects to real world examples & explains things well. I wish he addressed more social factors, but that's econ. Calculators aren't allowed on exams, but the math is easy arithmetic. Not many surprises on the exams- come to lecture & do the homework & you'll be ok.

The homework was super easy and his exams were straightforward. I'd advise coming to class and reading the textbook, but the slides are based on the textbook so a lot of people got away with not reading it. Would recommend.

Professor Braxton has to be the best professor I have had at UW. His lectures made sense, the textbook was helpful, and the homework also helped. His exams are super fair especially if you do the practice exams. I loved this class and I couldn't recommend Professor Braxton enough.

Braxton's lectures were very easy to follow and covered everything that was on the tests. Online textbook that I would sometimes skim to prepare for the next unit but you don't have to. Tests weren't too hard and there were no surprises. Homework took 30 minutes max and was very easy. Would definitely recommend taking his class.

I think Fall 2021 was Braxton's first semester as a professor at UW, but he did an amazing job! I struggled in Econ 101 with microeconomics, but he made macroeconomics very easy to understand. His lectures were a little slow at times, but for the most part, really helpful. He cares about his students and is willing to help no matter what!

This guy was the best professor I've ever had in my life. He is very thorough when explaining the topics and doesn't treat any question as a bad one. Really understanding person and responds super fast to emails.

Professor Braxton made macroeconomics super easy to understand. He was super nice and gave extremely fair exams. Practice exams are super useful before tests, and there are no surprises. Small weekly homework assignments from the textbook software that are for completion but can help you if you actually try on them.
